text.p: Merrill Lynch analyst Francisco Martins said in a report the brokerage began coverage of Mexican steelmaker Industrias CH as buy.

"The buy recommendation is based on the company's attractive valuation coupled with an intermediate term price objective of from 29 to 31 pesos per share," he wrote in a report dated April 18 and received by Reuters on Tuesday.

Martins said the stock was trading at a normalized cash flow multiple of 8.5 to nine times. Industrias was also trading at a an attractive discount when compared with other Latin American steel companies covered by the brokerage.
Its B shares were up 45 centavos to 27.50 pesos in early afternoon dealing on the Mexican bourse on Tuesday.
